message.content:
cs.AI, cs.CL, cs.NE, cs.LG, cs.CC. 

This paper presents a cognitive system based on a large-scale neural architecture that is capable of learning to communicate through natural language starting from tabula rasa. The system uses an open-ended incremental learning process and is able to learn nouns, verbs, adjectives, pronouns, and other word classes. Therefore, the most likely sub-categories are cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.CL (Computation and Language). The paper also mentions that the system is based on a neural network, which suggests that it could also belong to cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing). Additionally, the paper discusses the coordination of different components of the working memory, which could fall under cs.LG (Learning). Finally, the paper mentions the use of neural gating mechanisms, which could be relevant to cs.CC (Computational Complexity).
